translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Pairs of Doctrinal Ideas
The Doctrinal Ideas Associated with the Cankers

original: Āsavañceva āsavasampayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavo ceva naāsavavippayutto ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Āsavasampayuttañceva no ca āsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavavippayutto ceva nano ca āsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: āsavañca iva āsava sampayuttañca dhammam paṭicca na āsavaḥ ca iva na āsava vippayuttaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  āsava sampayuttam ca iva no ca āsavam dhammam paṭicca na āsava vippayuttaḥ ca iva na no ca āsavaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With the doctrinal ideas that are cankers and also associated with cankers as condition there arises what is not a canker and is dissociated from cankers. … There are three triplets.🔽With the doctrinal ideas that are associated with cankers but are not cankers as condition there arises what is dissociated from cankers but is not a canker. … There are three triplets.

original: Āsavañceva āsavasampayuttañca āsavavippayuttañceva no ca āsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca noāsavo ceva naāsavavippayutto ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: āsavam ca iva āsava sampayuttañca āsava vippayuttañca ca iva no ca āsavam ca dhammam paṭicca noāsavaḥ ca iva na āsava vippayuttaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With the doctrinal ideas that are cankers and also associated with cankers and that are dissociated from cankers but are not cankers as condition there arises what is not a canker and is dissociated from cankers. … There are three triplets. (In brief.)
With the cankers as condition there arises what is associated with the cankers. … There are nine. (Everywhere nine.)
